docs.title: Purdue Proton
docs.text: Purdue Proton is an educational RP2350B devboard with a detachable debug probe intended for use in embedded systems labs.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• RP2350B microcontroller
    • 520 kB SRAM
    • QFN-80 package
  • 16 MB quad SPI flash memory
  • Debugger based on Raspberry Pi Debug Probe design
  • USB-C connector on Proton board and debugger with ESD protection diodes
  • External 12 MHz crystal produces 150 MHz with onboard PLL
  • External 5V, 3.3V, and GND pins
  • Power indicator LEDs
    • 5V is red
    • 3V3 is green
  • 48 GPIO pins, external SWCLK/SWD pins
  • Push buttons for USB boot and reset
  • Two hardware-debounced push buttons connected to GP21 and GP26
  • Four user LEDs connected to GP22 (red), GP23 (yellow), GP24 (green), GP25 (blue)

docs.title: Lab Experiments
docs.text: Purdue Proton is used by embedded systems labs in ECE 36200 at Purdue University. Their labs can be found here. The labs cover embedded programming with the Pico SDK in C utilizing the PlatformIO IDE.

docs.title: Simpler components in your kit
docs.text:
• LM324 Quad Op-Amp
  • Clear common-anode RGB LED
  • 24AA32AF I2C EEPROM

For lab 6 - SPI, determine what type of display you have. The datasheets for both displays are below:

  • SMH1602-J LCD Display Datasheet (Fall 2025 and later)
  • SMH1602-J LCD Display Pinout (Fall 2025 and later)
  • SEH1602 OLED Display (prior to Fall 2025)

docs.title: 7-Segment Display Module
docs.text:
The schematic and PCB layout for the 7-segment display card can be downloaded here.

The datasheets for the components that make up the 7-segment display module are below:

  • PN2907A PNP bipolar junction transistor
  • 74HC138 3-to-8 decoder with active-low outputs
  • 74HC595 Shift Register
  • TLC59211 Sink Driver
  • TDCR1050M 4-digit common-anode 7-segment display
